translation.en: [lip-synching] ♪ Well, he walked up to me And he asked me if I wanted to dance ♪
translation.ko: 그 사람이 내게 다가와 물었어 함께 춤추지 않겠냐고

translation.en: ♪ He looked kinda nice And so I said I might take a chance ♪
translation.ko: 그 사람 제법 멋있어 보여 나도 좋다고 했지

translation.en: ♪ I didn't know just what to do ♪
♪ So I whispered, "I love you" ♪
♪ He said that he loved me too And then he kissed me ♪
translation.ko: 그 사람도 날 사랑한대 그리고 내게 키스했어

translation.en: ♪ Then he asked me to be his bride ♪
♪ And always be right by his side ♪
♪ I felt so happy I almost cried And then he kissed me ♪
translation.ko: 너무 행복해 눈물이 나려 했어 그리고 내게 키스했어

translation.en: Adventures in Babysitting?
Seriously, Lara Jean?
Now is not the time to be fantasizing about living in an '80s movie.
translation.ko: 지금 80년대 영화 속의 삶에 환상을 가질 때가 아니야

translation.en: Except for today, it's different because it's not a fantasy.
This is my real life.
Don't I look different to you?
Um...
No.
Yeah, I don't see it.
How?
Like someone that has a boyfriend would look.
You look like he's gonna be here soon and you haven't started getting ready.
translation.ko: 남자친구가 곧 올 건데 준비 하나도 안 한 사람 같아

translation.en: Have you even showered?
Get out.
[sniffs] I'm gonna take a shower.
[Lara Jean] People say fairy tales aren't real.
-But sometimes... -[doorbell rings]
...happily ever after is for real.
I've been thinking about this moment since I started reading romance novels.
translation.ko: 연애 소설을 읽기 시작했을 때부터 이 순간을 생각해 왔다

translation.en: My very first date.
How do I look?
Perfect.
You look fantastic, honey.
Okay.
Hi.
Hey.
What's up?
-Nothing much. -No?
Got you something.
-Oh, thank you. -Oh, hey, Kitty.
This is for you. Gerbera daisies are my favorite.
What restaurant did you pick? 'Cause I know some of the best.
translation.ko: - 코비 선생님 - 무슨 레스토랑 골랐어? 내가 좋은 곳 좀 아는데

translation.en: Okay, Dad... here. Put these in water. Go.
Say it out loud. Eleven o'clock?
Eleven o'clock.
Okay, have fun.
Not too much fun.
Bye.
My gosh, I've never been to Cardona's.
translation.ko: 나 사실 카도나스에 처음 와 봐

translation.en: [Peter chuckles] It's a good place.
-[Lara Jean] I'm so excited. -Yeah?
-[Lara Jean] This is good. Yeah! -[laughing] I think you're gonna like it.
translation.ko: 여기 좋다, 응! - 마음에 들 거야 - 진짜 예뻐

translation.en: -[Lara Jean] It's so beautiful. -Mm-hmm.
-For the signorina. -Thank you.
-And the signor. -Grazie.
Wow, they have big menus here.
The bigger the menu, the fancier the restaurant. Everybody knows that.
It's actually a two-fork restaurant.
They give you the second one just in case you knock the first one off the table.
translation.ko: 하나가 바닥에 떨어질 경우에 다른 거 쓰라고

translation.en: No, that's not... that's not it.
-That's what it is. -No, it's not.
Watch. You ready?
-Peter, stop. That's so embarrassing. -[Peter] Oh, my God. What's happening?
translation.ko: 피터, 하지 마, 창피해 - 이를 어쩌지? - 왜...

translation.en: -[fork clattering] -Peter.
It's a good thing I have my backup.
This is my first date.
I've never been a girlfriend before.
I hope I'm good at it.
-Hey. -Hmm? Give me your keys.
Oh, you really wanna drive?
I'm a good driver now!
I have a fear of driving in the snow, but guess what?
[singsong] It's not snowing.
-Okay, fine. Just please don't kill us. -Yes!
Please?
[Peter] How did you know about this?
[Lara Jean] I have my ways.
-Okay, you write a wish... -[Peter] Mm-hmm. and then you send it into the sky.
-That's not a wish. -What do you mean?
It's not a wish. It's happening right now, so it can't be a wish.
translation.ko: 이미 이뤄진 일이니까 소원이 될 수가 없지

translation.en: -What? -What?
What's up?
I just don't want this to end.
You're thinking about us ending right now?
translation.ko: 지금 여기에서 우리 사이 끝나는 걸 생각해?

translation.en: [laughs] It's just a thought that popped in my head, okay? Just...
translation.ko: 그냥 떠오른 생각일 뿐이야 알았지? 그냥...

translation.en: Well, tell that thought to get out of your head!
You can't think about us breaking up on our first date.
I just don't want us to break each other's hearts.
translation.ko: 서로의 마음을 아프게 하는 일 없었으면 좋겠어

translation.en: I promise I am not going to break your heart.
translation.ko: 난 절대로 네 마음 아프게 하지 않을 거야

translation.en: I promise not to break your heart.
-Do you love it? -I do.
-Look at that! That's awesome. -You have really great handwriting.
translation.ko: - 이것 봐! 완전 멋져 - 너 글씨 정말 잘 쓴다

translation.en: We can do it.
-[Peter] You got it. Yes! -Whoo!
Let it fill up.
That's cool.
-Oh, my gosh! -[Peter] There it goes.
We did it. It's so beautiful.
-You can still see our initials. -Mm-hmm.
I don't think I'm ever going to get used to how deep your car is.
translation.ko: 네 차는 너무 높아서 적응이 안 될 것 같아

translation.en: -[Peter laughing] It's a bit... -It's so tall.
It is a pretty, pretty tall wagon.
When I get down, I feel like I'm falling.
translation.ko: 차에서 내릴 때 넘어질 것 같아

translation.en: Then you should wait. I'll come around and catch you on the other side.
translation.ko: 그럼 내가 먼저 내려서 잡아 줄 테니 기다려

translation.en: -What? -So...
how was your first date?
And tell me like it wasn't me who took you.
translation.ko: 상대가 내가 아니었다고 생각하고 말해 봐

translation.en: It was...
perfect.
-Yeah? -Mm-hmm.
Okay, good night.
Okay. Good night.
Good night.
[Margot on phone] Flip the bigger part in your right hand over the smaller part in your left hand.
translation.ko: 오른손에 쥔 긴 끈을 들어서 왼손의 짧은 끈 위로 가게 해

translation.en: Are you sure we have to dress up like this?
You know the other kids aren't going to.
Okay, we're doing it, Kitty. It's what Dad wants.
[Margot] Aw, you guys look amazing. I love Korean New Year.
translation.ko: 둘 다 너무 예뻐 난 한국 설날이 좋아

translation.en: I really wish I was there.
[Kitty] Yeah, we do, too.
-I'm gonna send you a gazillion pictures. -[Dan] It's almost time!
translation.ko: - 사진 엄청나게 찍어 보낼게 - 시간 다 됐다

translation.en: We gotta go!
My girls.
Oh, no. Here it comes.
Like two beautiful little roses.
Is that Margot?
Honey, I wish you were here.
I do, too.
-I love you guys. -Bye.
I did it.
Yeah, I didn't think you could.
Good morning. You guys look great.
-Thanks! -Here you go, Doc.
Thanks, Jasmine.
Now, don't you feel left out you didn't wear your hanbok?
translation.ko: 너만 한복 안 입어서 소외된 느낌 안 들어?

translation.en: [flatly] Yes, Mom. Beyond devastated.
Thank you.
-[man] Want a beer, Dan? -[Dan] Yeah, why not?
[Carrie] So, Dan, are you dating anyone?
-[Grandma] Carrie! -[Carrie] It's just a question!
That doesn't mean you have to stay single forever.
[Lara Jean] My dad says it's important for us to keep our Korean heritage alive.
translation.ko: 아빠는 우리가 한국 문화를 이어 가는 게 중요하다고 하신다

translation.en: But I know the real reason we make such a big effort on the holidays
translation.ko: 근데 난 왜 우리가 명절에 이렇게 공들이는지 안다

translation.en: is because being around her family makes him feel closer to my mom.
translation.ko: 외가 식구들과 함께 있으면 엄마의 자취가 더 잘 느껴져서다

translation.en: So you have a boyfriend?
No offense or anything,
but I always thought you were a "no dating till college" type girl.
translation.ko: 난 네가 대학 가기 전까진 범생이로 지낼 줄 알았어

translation.en: His name is Peter, and he wouldn't be dating Lara Jean if it wasn't for me,
translation.ko: 이름은 피터야 내가 아니었으면 둘은 못 만났어

translation.en: 'cause he didn't even know she existed,
but I mailed a secret love letter that she wrote for him--
translation.ko: 언니가 피터한테 쓴 연애편지를 내가 부쳤거든

translation.en: Well, technically, she wrote five.
Anyway, they started fake dating to make his ex-girlfriend jealous,
translation.ko: 아무튼 둘이 사귀는 척을 했어 피터는 전 여친 질투심을 자극하고

translation.en: and to cover up her real crush,
but everything got weird and they started real dating,
translation.ko: 근데 상황이 이상하게 돼서 진짜 사귀기 시작했어

translation.en: and now they're real boyfriend and real girlfriend and they are adorable.
translation.ko: 이제 진짜 남친과 여친이 됐는데 둘이 완전 사랑스러워

translation.en: Cute story.
A little PG-13, but cute.
Show Haven a picture of him.
Shut up. This is your boyfriend?
Yeah, why?
Dude, I hate to be the one to tell you this,
translation.ko: 하필 내가 이런 말 꺼내서 좀 그런데

translation.en: but I saw a video of him and some girl doing it in a hot tub.
translation.ko: 얘랑 어떤 여자애가 자쿠지에서 하는 거 봤어

translation.en: Yeah, um... that was me.
But it's not what you think. We were just making out.
translation.ko: 언니가 생각하는 그거 말고 키스만 했어

translation.en: That's...
cool, actually.
I want some ice cream. You want some?
-Sure. -Sure.
[Dan] That's for you.
Thanks.
When Kitty mailed my love letters, I thought my life was over.
translation.ko: 키티가 내 편지들을 부쳤을 때 내 인생은 끝난 줄 알았다

translation.en: For weeks, I prayed John Ambrose's letter had gotten lost in the mail.
translation.ko: 존 앰브로즈한테 쓴 편지가 분실되길 몇 주나 기도했다

translation.en: And when I never heard anything back, I thought the nightmare was over.
translation.ko: 그리고 답장이 없길래 내 악몽도 끝난 줄 알았다

translation.en: But, I guess it wasn't.
[John Ambrose] Dear Lara Jean,
I couldn't believe when I opened that letter and it was from you. [chuckles]
translation.ko: 편지를 열었는데 네가 보내서 믿기지가 않았어

translation.en: Wow. It's been, what, five years since we've seen each other?
translation.ko: 세상에 우리 못 본 지 5년쯤 됐지?

translation.en: Not that I'm mad or anything. I was so happy to get it.
translation.ko: 화가 났거나 그런 건 아니야 편지 받고 정말 기뻤어

translation.en: I can't believe how mature you were at 11.
God, when I was 11, my mom was still putting out snacks for me after school,
translation.ko: 그때 난 여전히 간식도 엄마가 챙겨줘야 했던 애였는데

translation.en: but here you were with all these complex thoughts and emotions.
translation.ko: 넌 복잡한 생각과 감정으로 고민하고 있었다니

translation.en: It's crazy.
Reading it reminded me of that time that we both got locked out after school.
translation.ko: 편지 읽다가 그때 기억이 났어 방과 후에 집에 못 들어갔던 거

translation.en: -Remember that? -[wind chime jingling]
We went to the Robertson's treehouse and read Harry Potter until it got dark.
translation.ko: 로버트슨네 나무 집에 가서 해 질 녘까지 '해리 포터'를 읽었지

translation.en: If I'd written you a love letter back then,
I'm pretty sure it would've just said something like, um,
"I liked reading with you.
You're really pretty."
But your letter was so much more than that.
translation.ko: 그런데 네가 쓴 편지는 수준이 다르더라

translation.en: I just have one question: Why send it now?
translation.ko: 궁금한 게 있어 왜 이제야 보냈어?

translation.en: Whatever the reason, I'm really glad I got to read it.
translation.ko: 이유야 어떻든 편지 읽고 정말 기뻤어

translation.en: Yours, John Ambrose.
[Lara Jean] Oh, my God.
John Ambrose McClaren just wrote me a letter.
translation.ko: 존 앰브로즈 매클래런이 나한테 편지를 썼다

translation.en: Wait, does this mean he liked me in sixth grade, too?
translation.ko: 잠깐, 그럼 걔도 6학년 때 나를 좋아했던 거야?

translation.en: Does he like me now?
Okay. Calm down.
It's not a spontaneous love letter or anything.
translation.ko: 이건 마음에서 우러난 연애편지 같은 게 아니라

translation.en: It's more like a thank-you card.
There's no need to respond.
But... wouldn't it be rude not to respond?
translation.ko: 그런데 답장 안 하면 예의가 없는 거 아닐까?

translation.en: It would definitely be inconsiderate, so I respond.
translation.ko: 당연히 사려 깊지 못한 행동이지 그럼 답장해야겠다

translation.en: But, in a friendly way. Just be, like, polite.
Thank him for his letter and move on.
Dear John Ambrose,
I hope this letter finds you well.
Have you continued your interest in politics and diplomacy?
translation.ko: 정치 외교에 관심이 많더니 아직도 그래?

translation.en: I'm sure you're even more smart, considerate, and adorable--
translation.ko: 분명히 지금 너는 더 똑똑하고 사려 깊고 귀여운...

translation.en: What am I saying?
I can't say that.
Dear John Ambrose,
What lovely penmanship you have.
When I saw your name on the envelope, my heart skipped a beat, and then I--
translation.ko: 봉투에 적힌 네 이름을 보고 나 심쿵 했어, 그리고...

translation.en: [groans] I am so lame.
Dear John Ambrose,
First of all, thank you for writing me back.
It's nice to be in touch after so long.
I do remember that day in the treehouse reading until it was dark.
translation.ko: 나무 집에서 해 질 때까지 책 읽던 거 당연히 기억나지

translation.en: You said you were House Hufflepuff, and that was my house, too,
and I thought maybe that was a sign that we were meant to be.
translation.ko: 난 그게 우리가 인연이라는 징조가 아닐까 생각했어

translation.en: Oh, my God.
I cannot do this.
Do I have to tell Peter about this?
[woman on PA] All juniors, please report to the cafeteria
to choose your spring service commitments.
[chuckling] 'Sup, Covey?
-Ready? -Always.
-What is going on in that head of yours? -What do you mean?
translation.ko: - 지금 무슨 생각 중이야? - 무슨 말이야?

translation.en: Uh, snickerdoodles. They're your pensive bake.
translation.ko: 스니커두들 쿠키 생각 많을 때 굽는 거잖아

translation.en: -How do you know that? -I dunno. Maybe from...
that picture you posted on Instagram a few months ago, #pensivebake?
translation.ko: 몇 달 전 네 인스타그램 포스팅? '#생각이 많을 때 굽는 쿠키'라고

translation.en: [laughs] Oh, yeah. That's when I didn't know what was going on between us.
That's not what's going on now, I hope.
Do you remember when Kitty sent out my love letters?
translation.ko: 키티가 보낸 내가 쓴 연애편지들 기억나지?

translation.en: Is that a serious question?
[chuckles] No, of course you remember. But...
remember when you asked me who got the other ones,
translation.ko: 또 누구한테 편지 보냈냐고 네가 물었을 때

translation.en: and I said the last one went to someone from Model UN?
translation.ko: 마지막 편지는 모델 유엔에서 만난 애한테 갔다고 했잖아?

translation.en: Mm-hmm.
-It was John Ambrose McClaren. -No shit.
translation.ko: - 존 앰브로즈 매클래런이야 - 말도 안 돼

translation.en: McClaren? That was my boy.
Well, he wrote me back.
He wrote you-- Like, an actual... Like, an actual letter? Or an email? Or...
Yeah, like a real letter in the mail.
Huh.
He say anything about me?
-Like what? -I dunno.
Like, "Um, how's Kavinsky? How's he doing?"
[chuckling] Nope.
Did you write him back?
Not yet.
Oh, so you're, like... you're, like, going to, planning on it?
I probably should.
-Why? -Because it'd be rude not to.
Then, I don't know why you're telling me all this.
Are you asking for my permission or...
No, I just thought it was gonna be strange if I didn't tell you.
translation.ko: 아니, 너한테 말 안 하면 이상해질까 봐

translation.en: Please choose your service commitments wisely.
You will be representing Adler at your chosen post.
Expand your horizons, people! Thank you.
[Trevor] Yo! K, what's up, big boy?
-'Sup, LJ? -Hi, Trevor.
Yo, bro, so check it out.
We already snagged six spots at Oakwood Market.
Everybody's in, done deal.
Come on. Covey, let us sign you up.
-Oakwood? -Yes.
I kinda thought we'd volunteer at Belleview together.
Okay, I'm out. Uh, enjoy your fight.
translation.ko: 알았어, 난 빠질게 둘이 즐겁게 싸워

translation.en: Come on, let me sign you up. It'll be fun.
translation.ko: 그러지 말고 같이 하자 재밌을 거야

translation.en: [sighing] Margot volunteered at Belleview.
And, besides, Belleview looks better on college applications.
translation.ko: 게다가 대학교 지원서에 쓰기에도 벨뷰가 더 낫고

translation.en: I dunno, it was just the guys-- We kind of decided that
we were gonna do Oakwood when training started. But, um...
translation.ko: 다들 오크우드에서 한다고 결정을 해 버려서

translation.en: You should go. I'm gonna sign up for Belleview.
translation.ko: 넌 그렇게 해 난 벨뷰 신청할게

translation.en: -Are you sure -Mm-hmm.
Go sign up. Seriously.
Okay, well, let me make it up to you.
Let's meet after practice for coffee.
Five o'clock.
Sounds good.
-It's epic. -You're so lazy! It's epic.
Come on, you guys. Come sign up for Belleview with me.
translation.ko: 얘들아, 나랑 같이 벨뷰에 자원봉사 신청하자

translation.en: Playing Connect 4 with a bunch of octagenarians? No, thanks.
Oh, hell nah.
Nah, I already signed up for the soup kitchen.
Oh, I wrote a proposal for a new program.
Rescue Animal Welfare.
Chris, this is you hanging out with your dog at home.
translation.ko: 크리스, 이건 집에서 너랑 강아지랑 노는 거잖아

translation.en: Yeah, a dog who's a rescue.
[chuckling] It's genius, right?
No, that is genius. I'm with you on this one, Chris.
translation.ko: 진짜 천재다 이건 나도 동의해, 크리스

translation.en: [Gen] Of course you would do Belleview.
You're so predictable, Lara Jean. It's quite adorable.
translation.ko: 어찌나 뻔한지, 라라 진 꽤 귀엽다

translation.en: -I guess you're doing Oakwood. -Sorting through half-rotten produce?
translation.ko: - 넌 오크우드 하겠네? - 반쯤 썩은 농산물 골라내기?

translation.en: No, thank you.
So, I saw on your story that you went to Cardona's this weekend?
Classic Kavinsky.
You know, by the time we broke up, I actually thought I was gonna die
translation.ko: 우리 헤어질 때쯤에는 '카초 에 페페'는 물려서

translation.en: if I had any more cacio e pepe.
Pro tip: If you do want to fit into your jeans come summer,
translation.ko: 꿀팁 하나 줄게 여름에도 청바지 잘 맞으려면

translation.en: you should probably start ordering salad.
[Lara Jean] When Peter and I got together,
I didn't expect to feel so insecure about his past relationship with Gen.
translation.ko: 젠과 만났던 사이란 사실이 이렇게 신경 쓰일 줄 몰랐다

translation.en: But for every first I was having with him,
translation.ko: 그런데 내가 피터와 처음으로 하는 건 뭐든지

translation.en: he'd already had his with her.
translation.ko: 피터는 이미 젠과 해 본 거다

translation.en: [girl] Sorry, are you using this chair?
Yeah. It's for my boyfriend. I'm sorry.
You don't need this chair, do you, Lara Jean?
I do.
Peter's on his way.
-He's just running a little behind. -Is he?
-Is anybody using this chair? -Yes. My boyfriend, he's coming.
translation.ko: - 이 의자 누가 써? - 응, 남자친구가 올 거야

translation.en: Okay, I am so sorry, Covey. I--
Coach made us run the bleachers until everyone practically puked.
